programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 7, episode 2:

Spotlight on bread by the Poilâne family. The swimsuit: a story studded with scandal. In his Parisian workshop at the Viaduc des Arts, Philippe Atienza reveals the craft of the boot-maker to the public gaze. How to wear a long necklace. The portrait of eyewear manufacturer Amaury Cagniard, master craftsman.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: The sandwich challenge Forget the crustless sandwich as we bring you a world of sandwiches redesigned by Samir Benzeguir, alias Capitain Sandwich. We sample Montréal's best banh mi and a gluten-free special by K pour Katrine. Presenter : Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Alice Guy, l'inconnue du 7ème art
programme.desc:
Who has heard of Alice Guy (1873-1968)? The name of this Frenchwoman was erased from the history of cinema, even before her death. A thousand films, a career that spanned both sides of the Atlantic, she was the first woman director, scriptwriter, producer and studio director. Portrait of a pioneer.

Directed by: Nathalie Masduraud, Valérie Urrea (France, 2021)

Narrated by: Agnès Jaoui, Maud Wyler.

programme.title: Les nouveaux nomades
programme.desc: Sophie explores Pays Toy, in the Pyrenees. When talking about Saint-Nazaire it's usually industry and shipbuilding that come to mind. But recently the town has placed greater emphasis on its coastline. Éric heads behind the scenes in the Cussac Cave. Yvan goes mushroom picking in a somewhat unusual spot. Presented by: Sophie Jovillard, Julie Hattu, Éric Perrin, Yvan Hallouin.

programme.title: Épicerie fine, terroirs gourmands
programme.desc: The Côte d'Albâtre The Côte d'Albâtre, on the Channel coast of Normandy. Baptiste Lemonier opens the doors to his dairy farm, the Bois-des-Saules. Gladys Heude, market-gardener in Cauville-sur-Mer, takes us to pick herbs and edible flowers. Cyriaque Lethuillier shares his love for the cliffs of Étretat. Focus on the history of the herring. Presented by: Guy Martin.

programme.title: Ça roule en cuisine
programme.desc: "Jardins by La Cloche" Sophie Menut is in Dijon, Burgundy. She has an appointment with Aurélien Mauny, the chef of "Jardins by La Cloche", a restaurant in the Grand Hôtel La Cloche, where he serves a decidedly bistronomic menu. Presentation: Sophie Menut.

programme.title: La recette de Guy Martin
programme.sub-title: Filet de boeuf charolais, croûte d'ail noir, courgettes et jus café
programme.desc: Fillet of Charolais beef with a black garlic crust, courgettes and coffee gravy The Michelin-starred chef Guy Martin presents products emblematic of France and suggests a recipe to prepare them. Presented by: Guy Martin.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Heading for the Tian Shan range The two-day coach ride from Ürümqi to the Tian Shan mountains requires a great deal of patience from the climbers but the landscapes and the people they meet make it worth it. They finally spot the Tian Shan foothills. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Vachement Normand !
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Muffin recipes
Ricardo suggests a selection of muffin recipes for a filling snack easy to eat on the go: apricot muffins, sweetcorn muffins and pear, date and cream cheese muffins.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: A visit behind the scenes of the Château de Versailles Royal Opera House, by the architect Ange-Jacques Gabriel. A new type of gallery-owner, Amélie du Chalard reinvents the profession, bringing art into the home, both hers and yours. Paris in the footsteps of General de Gaulle. Focus on French bagpipes. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.sub-title: Joran Briand et Arnaud Berthereau/Le papier
programme.desc: From western France to Paris, the designers Joran Briand and Arnaud Berthereau bring their very French touch to the world of design. Paper isn't just for writing on, in the hands of Sandrine Beaudun it's transformed into delicate sculptures, as light as air. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Heading for the Tian Shan range The two-day coach ride from Ürümqi to the Tian Shan mountains requires a great deal of patience from the climbers but the landscapes and the people they meet make it worth it. They finally spot the Tian Shan foothills. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc:
A visit to the Cognacq-Jay Museum, home to the 18th century artworks collected by Ernest Cognacq and Marie-Louise Jay. Interior designer Bruno Borrione advocates an uninhibited style using materials with character. Glenn Martens brings a fresh look to the Jean Paul Gaultier fashion house. All the expertise of Peruke.
Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Croustade aux pommes et aux courges
programme.desc: Apple and squash croustade Blake Mackay prepares a croustade that combines squash and apple to perfection. And to ensure nothing goes to waste, the apple skins and core are used to create home-made vinegar. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Nos maisons
programme.desc: Bungalow Built to house families after the baby-boom, Quebec's bungalows are typical of the suburbs, each with their rectangular layout, basement and carport. Directed by: Mathieu Baer (Canada, 2019)

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Monaco special Behind the scenes at the famous Monte-Carlo casino. Encounter with the chef Marcel Ravin in charge of the kitchens of the Monte-Carlo Bay Hotel & Resort, where he offers an innovative and sophisticated gastronomic cuisine. Gaming and roulette tables: the expertise of the Monte-Carlo workshops. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: It's time to revise your scales and arpeggios ready for an appointment behind the scenes of the Paris Philharmonic. The youngest Michelin-starred chef in France welcomes us to her restaurant. We discover some of the well-kept gourmet secrets of Julia Sedefdjian, chef at the Baieta. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Heading for the Tian Shan range The two-day coach ride from Ürümqi to the Tian Shan mountains requires a great deal of patience from the climbers but the landscapes and the people they meet make it worth it. They finally spot the Tian Shan foothills. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Creemore, Ontario
Around fifty bats have taken up residence in an old house. Louis' mission is to gently move them out.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Moi j'mange
programme.desc:
Growing in my garden!
On the menu: Greek salad with tofu feta, melon and mint gazpacho, Korean-style grilled vegetables and chicken.
Presented by: Stéphane Bellavance. Directed by: Patrice Ouimet (season 2, Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the French Senate, a building steeped in history. Ceramists from father to son, we meet François from the Jean Roger family. Three addresses for all fans of turntables and vinyl records. Focus on the chistera, the strange wicker glove emblematic of the Basque game of pelota. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde

programme.title: Ding dong : montre-moi ta maison !
programme.desc:
Episode 2
Viola begins by offering us a tour of an amazing house, its roof and walls covered by solar panels. Then she visits a surprising home-workshop-studio belonging to an artist-shepherd and a magnificent villa with direct lake access and an owner who is somewhat unusual ... to say the least.
Presented by: Viola Tami. Directed by: Karen Ballmer (Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Les saisons de Pique-assiette
programme.sub-title: Fregola aux coques, fèves et artichauts
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Chroniques d'en haut

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.sub-title: Nathanaël Désormeaux et Damien Carrette/Le verre
programme.desc: Encounter with Nathanaël Désormeaux and Damien Carrette who open the doors to their world of design with its fun pop ambiance. Thomas Segaud, glass-blower, recounts his passion. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Diois
We head for the Diois, in the company of Alain, to discover a world of colour and scent in his lavender fields. Céline collects pollen from her hives. A watery journey, through the Bouligons marshes and along the river Drôme. All about the Clairette de Die.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Natural attractions near Dijon A few kilometres from Dijon, between the river and the forest, lies a land boasting many resources: the Val-Suzon. Guillaume sets off to meet the fans of this conservation area where the forest is still a source of great emotion... And truffles! Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.
